meanings.definition: Not based on or provable by experiment or experience.
meanings.sent1: The scientist rejected the unempirical theory as it lacked evidence.
meanings.sent2: Her unempirical beliefs were not supported by any real-life examples.
meanings.sent3: It was quite unempirical to claim that unicorns exist without any proof.
meanings.sent4: His unempirical approach to problem-solving led to many errors.
meanings.sent5: The unempirical nature of the conspiracy theory made it hard to believe.

meanings.definition: Not empirical; not derived from or guided by experience or experiment.
meanings.sent1: The philosopher's argument was dismissed as unempirical by the scientific community.
meanings.sent2: Their decision seemed unempirical, lacking any real-world data to support it.
meanings.sent3: It was unempirical to trust a fortune teller's predictions without any proof.
meanings.sent4: The artist's unempirical style challenged traditional artistic norms.
meanings.sent5: The unempirical nature of the folklore made it difficult to believe in.
